description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Work life balance and transport facility that too a tidious one.
cons: Development managers are bad. Only politics. Less work but still puts pressure. HRs feel like they own the company and and changes policies as per their will. Only those can survive who does buttering of their managers. Promotions onsites and good project to only those who butter the manager.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros:
Higher salary comparing to market.
Handsome amount of quarterly Bonus.
cons:
No career growth unless you are favourite of management.
Good relation with manager id more important than your hard and smart work.
Some HR policies are not employee favourable.
Notice period is too long ie three months/ 90 Days. (Only Management favorite people get concession).
Promotion rule  of 18 months for next level not applicable to Management favorite people.
HR persons are not easily accessible.
advice: Promotion should be given on the basis of work and not on the basis how closer you are to Management.

description: I worked at Travelex
pros: Pay is good, good people are leaving,
cons: Lot of unnecessary stress and politics.. Work culture is not good and management plays blame game and lower level employee suffers big time..  No planning and work is dump on lower level employee. Job security is an issue
advice: Please become people focus..  Instead of doing micro management trust your employees and you will see positive results

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years

3. Quaterly bonus depends on how much you backbite and provide as much information of your own...

pros:
Supportive stakeholders

Good cafe
Clean environment

Managers only supports employees who take break with them. Bonus is distributed as position and not as per the  individuals efforts.

Daily activity  trackers are easily manipulated by manager's favourite employees and no actions are taken against them. 

Rewards and recognitions are distributed as per managers favouritism and not as per the performance. 

Manager's favourite employees are cross trained on...

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Nothing , if anyone can learn to convert (specifically Prod support dept head) good things to extremely bad , should get a detail grasp
cons:
Random decision making system without any historical background/education /experience considered
Things are drive mostly on relationship and well covered with mails and meetings to divert the actual attention. 
Employees are kept on PIP later, first decision has been made to remove them.
IF you are good at ego management of upline rather than managing or learning technology , this is your place.
advice: If leadership change plan was implemented , how and why someone still leftover who plan and execute everything in background.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time
pros:
Being part of software development  team from past couple of years, i can say that few positive major initiatives have been taken in order to change the way how the company's Management and technology decisions are taken.

I am happy that the current focus of Travelex is the Cloud Transformation which will help the company to first find out the applications which are worth to migrate on cloud or needs an upgrade...
cons: Have seen many times that third party technology solutions are  from Vendors which are not ready to support well for issues in their systems. In such cases, Vendors should be pressurized rather than wasting money, time  and effort of solving someone else errors.
advice: Need to be proactive and stream line the projects used rather than creating hell lot of different applications of which more than half of the company people are not aware and creating chaos.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: Very good boss joined in 2018...fostered open and transparent culture and provided opportunity....great work life balance
cons: more legacy systems...need to innovate and get more cutting edge work to Mumbai
advice: think of office in more central location of Mumbai

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than 5 years

Stop this bias thing and Plz implement the policy to the entire hr team and and entire Mumbai employees who propose this policy...

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
role: Former Employee - IT Service Desk Analyst
pros:
-Quarterly bonus every 3 months
-Shift allowance
-Pick up and drop facility.
-Cultural event every year
cons:
-Poor Management
-Workinh on old technologies nothing much to learn 
-Rewards and bonus are given to only boss favourites employees 
-Sick leave or emergency leave affects you score 
-No stream line process 
-Lack of coordination within team leaders. 
-They don't value their key employees 
-Poor Roster management 
-Lack of process knowledge 
-Repetitive task, no support from management.
advice:
-They should work on the above cons.
-Rewards and appreciation should be given to deserving and efficient employees.
-Stop doing Favouritism
-Build the team bonding.
-Give chances to other people who are better than your favourites.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time
pros:
Work life balance and flexible working hours
Good salary compared to IT companies
Most managers are understanding
cons:
Technical debt means many people get stuck with old technology and repetitive tasks
Less scope for internal promotions and growth
advice: Believe in your people to do challenging work and continue on transformation journey

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year

Timely salary
Work life balance
Good office infra
Drop facility

advice: Please don't occupy those positions for namesake and try to do justice to the position. You are simply wasting the money which could have been given to people on ground who actually deliver.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for less than a year

There exists a lead for a team, where our manager blindly believes him as they both have old rapo... Apart this the work environment was...

The main bigggggggggggg thing is recently rhey had a layofff in HR team itself...., They hired fresher as TRPs and terminated them after 1 year completion...They have a bloody advantage to woman employees.... If any issue persists the ultimate decision would be given to a woman. Donno where this started from. 
Restricted scope of growth.
They promise some figure at CTC discussion and after many cutting would be...

pros: more things to learn in travelex

description: I worked at Travelex
pros: Easy work to go with. Lucrative work environment with floor amenities of some standard.  Flexible work timings giving healthy work-life balance. Transport facility an addon.
cons: No challenge in working projects with impotent functional roles. Lethargic attitude of management towards change, having no vision giving negative signals to employees over stability & sustainbility both.  Power culture & heirarchy culture is absolutely missing. Overall career progression limited to bare minimum.
advice: Develop a positive work culture with vibrant work force & sound technical solutions.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time
pros:
Work life balance
On time salary
cons:
Work on legacy technologies.
Managers here are horrible, pathetic, biased, political, non skilled in Dev and Test vertical. They only promote people with whim they share good equation. Performance of their subordinates doesn't matter to them much. They have very very poor people management skills and negligible technical skills, but are very good at creating an aura of excellence abut themselves.
advice:
Please change the managers and bring in skilled, passionate and people with integrity.
There are some good people below Managers, but eventually they would be frustrated and quit the organization due to horrible so called managers.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time

You are not allowed to use your brain and have to follow what the management says.  Managers here are the worst. They abuse their power and have no clue how to run their business. Employees are not treated with respect. They losing on a lot...
advice: Respect your employees.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than a year

Extreme favourism for people who are connected with IBU heads & no rules , regulation & performance scale for them .
But everything applicable for mid level mgr who are not connected with heads

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros:
I don't think Travelex as a company has anything good for the employee, apart from giving salary on time.

Location-between 2 malls

Travelex has a list of disadvantage:
Poor management
Politics
The employee will be frustrated after working with this employee. so please choose this as a last option if you have another offer.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: Great change had been made this week. Should have done much earlier, I hope that woman will feel more safe and people will be more productive after this Sr. Level change. Some more such changes are required in test function to improve the test managers and test function. Many Thanks to Travelex Director and HR for this long pending change.
cons: Things will improve going forward
advice: Please take some review for test function also, as there are only presentations and good English but no good work.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros:
One of the few organisations which gives horizontal as well as vertical exposure and an opportunity to lead.
One of the best placed GDC/GIC (500 odd employees) to offer varied roles and opportunities
Teams can decide everything except few nuances which is great cause if you invest, put efforts, nothing stops you here.
Good potential is recognised across the board
Organisation is adopting latest delivery...
cons: Bit perception based and typecasting but that's obvious as it's everywhere
advice: Invest in breadth of services, BAU is always critical in captives but we need to treat change, transformation and BAU with different yard sticks and approach

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros:
Friendly environment, I have seen many companies in my career but travelex is one of the best among them.
Good inline projects.
You will learn new technologies.
Managers are very helpful.
Good respectable place for women as well.
You will get good scope to show your skills whereas you hardly get this chance anywhere else.
cons: If you are really talented stay away from people who spreads negativity.
advice: Arrange the bus facility till andheri rather than individual cab home drop.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros:
Work Culture is good !!
Flexible Time!!
Admin is really good!
Good salary!
cons:
Too much politics and favouritism 

Upper management blindly trust managers and doesnt verify if information received is correct or not & takes decision on them only.

None of managers are leaders , instead of motivating they keeps you demotivated.

Managers doesnt want to manage people they want to rule

Managers doesnt take responsibilities and ownership if something goes wrong and always ready to blame...

HR and Upper Management , Verify feedback you get. 80% of time its not true what you get from managers.

Face of travelex should be those people who deserves and not people who are closed to managers.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time
pros:
Flexible time
Good team members
Great exposure to international stakeholders
cons:
Biased 
One will never grow because managers only like to talk about themselves and show themselves in limelight
advice: It would not matter since no opinions are considered.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time
pros:
1) Office decor is excellent
2) Being a captive unit, facilities like Transport, insurance, travel opportunities etc., are good.
3) Recent addition of play zone is amazing.
4) Some people are very friendly
cons:
1) Local management is a 'rubber stamp', all decisions are taken in UK without informing or consulting the so called SME's including the senior management in Mumbai
2) Too much micro management.
3) People in UK prefer to promote and work with people who don't challenge the status quo and nod to what ever UK guys say.
4) IT 'sucks' big time.  Most of the time there are no network cables in meeting rooms, printers...
advice:
Be more proactive and spend money where it would benefit employees.
Get some more powers to run your own center.
Too much reliance on UK is making you look very small even after most of you have fancy designations

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: On-time Salary, Good collaborative environment, Decent travel opportunities if you are in Managers good book.
cons: Pathetic Top Management, Favouritsim, Yes Sir culture. People are not allowed to do what they were hired for. Rather they are made to do things which are inconsequential and irrelevant. Too many and too frequent meetings consume most of the productive hours. No one bothers to find the rot and address it, rather they turn their eyes away from the problem assuming nothing is wrong. Centre is on the verge of collapse...
advice: Get rid of your non performing Sr Management.

description: I worked at Travelex
pros:
Very good company to work 
Software awesome to work
Many training sessions 
Staffs are also friendly
cons: I have not come accross any cons till I was working.
advice: Keep updating job vacancies on your website

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros:
Good office interiors - at least the new one
Home drop facility
Descent overseas travel
cons:
Poor management skills. I really doubt if any of the heads of functions are even capable of getting job elsewhere. No culture of meritocracy and only favorites prevailed.
Some of these members are not even full time graduates leave aside trained managers

HR, which should be face of organization is only bothered for her looks and personal gains and position rather than what is right for broader organization...
advice:
Get some professional and outward looking management. If that is not possible at least don't let someone of that statue leave the place
Understand difference between cash flow management and cost cutting
Wearing suite or tie is one thing and having a view as well as voice for something is other. 
Seek some substance in leadership instead of people who would say Yes Sir or mimic your actions
Realize attrition...

description: I worked at Travelex full-time
pros: Only Pro is to go to abroad without any knowledge

Hiring of Inexperienced people

Hire experienced people who can  manage projects better

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros:
1. Healthy annual salary hikes
2. Fair Variable Compensation Schemes
3. Decent office interiors and other facilities
4. Flexible Work Timings
5. Manageable Work Load
6. No over-time culture (Very rare occurrence)
7. Friendly work environment
8. Gaming Zone
9. Hackathon/Innovation Competitions
10. Annual Parties/Events/Fun Committee
cons:
1. Middle-level managers have poor people management skills
2. No career advancement/fewer opportunities
3. Leadership team lack skills to identify and nourish potential talent
4. People who can make or break careers are very random and unprofessional in their approach
5. People are deprived of necessary motivation
6. Management does not have proper knowledge of organizational policies
7. People are given...
advice:
1. Improve People Management skills of the Middle-Level Management and impart them basic training related to organizational policies.
2. Be more close and in touch with the people working at the ground level
3. Identify potential talent and nourish them so that they could sustain for more longer periods with the organization and add value to the business.
4. Motivate people to learn new things, acquire...

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros:
1. Flexibility to work the way you want - work from home, work at your time as long as it meets company's expectations
2. Small but an international company. I reported to international managers
3. Good facilities and business support functions
4. You learn to expect less and be happier that way
5. I really loved the training, in very different and unique way.
6. If you believe that you can weather out a storm,...
cons:
1. Too much churn and organizational changes. No effective change management process.
2. It's people based rather than process based, so you depend on people to get work done which is always tricky in international environment.
3. Being asked to do whatever is available so if you look to grow your career in a certain direction, it may become luck dependent.
4. Huge work pressure and not enough support.
5. No...
advice:
Please have some long term vision & align the team's mission & action as per the vision. No Vision means No result.
Try to make at least some decisions in India and take responsibility for the outcome of those

description: I worked at Travelex
pros: Team party ... dey get huge budget for this ... yearly bonus and can give good package ..
cons: Dumb people ... dumb management ... technically zero people .. complete control of Indian management ... that is why .. it became more worst ..no trainings .. no personal development .. people working from last 5 years and more make it more worst .. becoz they are seriously so dumb ....
advice: UK management should take back all the control...

description: I worked at Travelex
pros:
1)pickup/drop facility
2)extra earning through oncall
3)some random trainings
cons:
1) old technology
2) dirty politics 
3)more focus on process than work
advice:
Advice!!
Advising anything to management is like sowing seeds in baren land

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros:
1. Good work life balance
2.good team to work with
3.proper UK culture is followed
4.nice office 
5.good pay and bonus
cons:
1.not growing opportunity
2.no proper process is followed 
3.not good for fresher
advice: All d best :)

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: Company have friendly environment. Couligs are friendly and very help full.
cons: Some projects have lot of pressure while some are old / stable. Your frustration level depend on the project.
advice: Start to trust your employee. If you assign any task. Just let them do it. Dont keep checking in 5 min for status. Stop shouting at your employee in front of all. They will just keeping leaving company.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Good Work Life Balance. Architecture team knows what they are doing.
cons: Needs to have more processes setup and processes shouldn't come in way of deliveries. More templates should be made available for different SDLC processes, i am giving this review for only Travelex India, globally Travelex is a wonderful company to be associated with
advice: Stop Micro Management and trust the team

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros:
Transportation, Location, overall facilities
Team members are cooperative and accessibility to management
cons:
Manager being extra overpowering, and pressing for deliverable
Only my manager is the only star we have :-)
Managing attrition is a bigger challenge
advice:
At least understand to have skip level at manager level individually.
Change of title is not the career management and for career development HR and senior management should put their heads together.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros:
Good environment to work with .
Good growth.
Good opportunity.
cons:
Planning is lacking
Lack of onsite coordination
advice: Please do a proper planning before commitment

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Location, transport, teams and individuals, few really good managers and sr managers
cons:
Firefighting and BAU work all the time, no planning or organizing, change control is missing everywhere - requirements can come during UAT or even pre-production, working on weekends is norm rather than exception
Poor infrastructure and driven by UK based management
Local management lacks supporting the teams here and confronting their UK counterparts
advice:
Provide work-life balance, enhance company infrastructure and look beyond today's deliverable

Think of people as humans rather than machines running 24 X 7

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: Lots of technologies to work on. Line mangers are very supportive. Good appraisal and yearly bonus.
cons: The organisation has significantly grown larger but some employees and management still behave like working in a small firm with no proper work ethics n personal behaviour.
advice:
Please review inter-personal and logical skills of employees at the time of interview.
Process should be followed as the organisation has grown and ad-hoc work can only result to a chaotic workplace.

description: I have been working at Travelex
pros:
It's MNC company. Good in foreign exchange
Good to hear that it recently took over business of Thomas cook
cons: As per other people review it seems not too good to work
advice: Not in my hand

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: Brand name of working in a MNC.
cons: Everything ,it is sweatshop albeit a glorified one, low pay compared to work,no weekdays, have to work like slave,no work life balance.attrition is high.join  only you do not have job.
advice: none as  they will not change.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros:
Provides training, but on weekends, so if you want to lear need to sacrifice personal life a bit.
Nice people to work with, specially my team.
Transport facility is there.
cons:
No proper management in the project, requirements keeps on coming even if the testing is in UAT phase. Everything is urgent.
Did not try to retain people.
Proper management is still under construction, no proper processes.
Management did not stand for there employee, if some one from UK says something they just blindly follow ask you to stay late even if it is of no use.
Promotion policy is not at all clear, one...
advice:
Please try to retain employees, at least those who work.
Improve the cafeteria, food is not all good.
Vehicles in the transport are not good.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than 5 years
pros: Great work culture and people
cons: Poor management and pay scalaes
advice: be practical

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros:
Good working environment
Flexible timing
pay is good upto market level
cons:
Not too much to explore
limited role and responsibility
advice: Encourage employees to take on greater role and reward not only monetarily but give them post hike too.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: People with Co-Operative Attitude and Helpful
cons: Paucity of Proper Management and Employee
advice: Hire good people and reduce the work pressure

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros: Good Environment, Decipline and Well Professionled.
cons: Very much foucus on Rules & regulation.
advice: Should be more faithful on its employees.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: Senior Leadership keep the wider business informed of changes, updates .etc. Support from direct manager. Opportunities to implement/change processes. Internal progression and recognition for your successes. Good in house training programmess specifically for support function employees. Manager who is willing to allow off site visits/training if it will help with your role.
cons: System access is a long process. Online learning modules do not log properly and it means you have to duplicate them.
advice: Think about the new starter on boarding and how much of an impact a good experience can have to retaining staff. Understanding the retail staff are key to our business and being more flexible with them

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros:
- Exciting stage of growth and transformation
- Friendly people & culture
- Amazing location and office space
cons: - Slightly volatile given the stage of transformation
advice: Continue investing in your people and success will come

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 5 years
pros:
- Great work balance
- Some managers are great! People focus
cons:
- Restructure almost every year which makes you fight for your role 
- No stability 
- Old way thinking. Scared to change and too comfort in their WoW which leads to no improvement 
- You are treated like a number and not a person
- Unfair growth, you must be within in their little clique to progress and skip the line for particular positions 
- Pay is terrible! 50% less than what other business are paying for...
advice: Speak with your frontline staff rather than area managers to gather more understanding. Accept change because its the improvement you need, and stop with restructures. I understand its great for a business, but restructure every two years is ridiculous - it shows no stability within an organisations.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros:
Open to innovation
Very friendly colleagues
Access to open ear of senior management
Stable core business
You are given ownership of your area
Willing to help seed-fund your ideas
Autonomy as standard
cons:
Onboarding can be challenging (however is being worked on)
Structures and reporting lines aren't always obvious
advice: Formalise onboarding process and comms channels

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Easy work as nothing ever seems to happen or progress.
cons: Poor salary. No bonuses, unless you are at a senior level or customer facing. Efforts and good ideas go completely unrecognized and unacknowledged. Staff ignored by senior management who have a lack of direction and no workable strategy. Senior management is definitely a 'boys club' culture - they all look after each other and not the interests of the wider company, sadly. Have witnessed sexist attitudes a lot from...
advice: Engage with what the business needs rather than what you want for yourselves. The lower level staff are effectively running the core business by themselves. Stop squandering the money that has been generated from the core business on any more silly 'fly by night' ideas. Treat employees with more respect and recognition.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros: Self development and meeting hundreds of people from all over the world very diverse culture.
cons: Management and pay was really bad.
advice: Hierarchical needs to look after their colleagues.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: I joined Travelex just over 18 months ago. The best career decision I've made. The support and friendliness of everyone I've come in to contact with in the company makes you feel part of a happy family. The management team are on your level and support you at all times. I now look forward to going to work and feel appreciated.
cons: I'm yet to find any.
advice: Keep doing what you're doing.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 10 years
pros: Working with my peers and team
cons: Management do not look after staff
advice: Look after staff

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: Great management team, all very approachable! Willing to offer advice and answer any questions when needed. Opportunties to complete apprenticeship courses if wanting to develop skills. Opportunities to gain good experience in working in other local bureaux. Great communication via phone/email to assist with support during lone working shifts.
cons: Although there are chances to progress in the company, sometimes these opportunties can be few & far between, unless willing to relocate.
advice: More support needed from management when a bureau is short staffed. BM/TMAs can sometimes feel isolated when struggling to find cover to no avail.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time
pros:
- Barista who makes us coffee around the clock
- Get to work from home as per managers discretion 
- Always learning new process and being innovative 
- You get the opportunity to work on different projects globally
cons:
- you do not always get recognition to the work and effort you put in
- you can give your opinions but your not always heard
- hit rock bottom in your role as there is no progression
- Financially you only get one review a year and that is at managers discretion to there is no pay reward increment yearly or bonuses just the one review the whole company is supposedly gets on your appraisal.
advice:
- Be fair to everyone 
- Everyone works different don't worry about what 'Other' employees will say if we work in your team  you manage it
- Give clearer instructions when it comes to holidays

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros:
- Extremely bright colleagues working across all business units; there is always an opportunity to go and speak to someone and you will learn something new. 

- Innovative programmes of delivery makes the work environment very fast paced and gives a "start-up" vibe. Everyone works together in a "flat hierarchy" fashion which gives the opportunity to all colleagues to have their voice heard. 

- Travelex is a...
cons: - As the company grows fairly quickly, processes in place within the business need to be adapted; it's all about striking the balance between giving enough freedom to move fast and having the right processes in place to facilitate tracking and spot issues early enough without it becoming a burden.
advice:
- It would be great to see new colleagues coming to join us from industries outside ours to get new learnings  and open up new ways of thinking. 
- With Finablr IPO launch earlier in May, I'd love to see more communications from our execs on our plans alongside the rest of the Finablr group. Email is one way to do so but it needs to be regular; Videos, F2F Q&As are other ways to engage colleagues.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros: worked in rota system 3 days on 3days off, I get lots of time to spend time with my family if I book 3 days off I get 9 days off and colleagues are very friendly and helpful.
cons: Most of the VAT Passengers are Chinese and Arabs but Chinese ppl are very smart and organised, but some of the arabs won't fill the form and they bring lots off forms and dump on our counters and expect us to fill they forms, that behaver is makes me very angry.
advice: helpful Management

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros:
CSR around you, always happy to help even more than managers
Free parking
Gain customer service experience
cons:
Where to start? Worked both nights and days, would not recommend days to my worst enemy. 
 Two of the 'Team Leaders' sit at each others desk chatting and shopping for shoes/holidays, when you approach them to ask a question you get ignored or they roll their eyes at you, they are best friends outside of work and totally unprofessional about it as bring this into work, they also both go on lunch at the same time......
advice: I felt so depressed being at Travelex, being on nights was a lot better as there is more support and better managers. You need to review the amount of calls you receive with the same problems and address these issues. You need to remind your team leaders that they are here to do their job not socialise and look at holiday. Your supervisors should be there to help, not be racist and bully employees. Review your pay...

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: The people are the biggest draw here and it is never a dull moment if you like change, the flexibility to operate beyond your remit and want to carve a career that will take you out of your comfort zone and give you exposure to other work streams/career pathways most traditional businesses wouldn't give you. Coffee on tap if you need it and a casual vibe. Super D&I agenda and dynamics. Kings Cross is...
cons: The business can be guilty of over promoting, allowing you to take on more than you can chew! And often there isn't the support mechanism to set you up for success, you drive that yourself. Not so competitive when it comes to salary and benefits.
advice: Greater visibility and voice from the leadership team please. There are hugely important and game changing projects in the pipeline and lots of wins to come, more group/town hall face to face communications with updates rather than blanket emails.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros: I've only been here for a few months but I can immediately see the buzz in the working environment where everyone is working towards creating value which has impact. Environment is friendly and most people are easily approachable and very helpful. Company is constantly looking to innovate. Enough opportunities to work on tasks without being siloed into your niche. Work life balance and flexibility seem fine at the...
cons: Internal processes and structures are not as matured as usually found in matured environments. However, suggestions are welcomed on how to change.
advice: It would be great if Top Management had more interactive sessions to hear any concerns or suggestions from the associates. Would be great to see standard tools for communication and collaboration.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros:
People are great
Growth opportunities by learning on the job in similar areas 
Taking responsibility 
Dress code is relaxed
Ability to speak my mind
cons: Communication can be improved between teams and departments
advice:
Define and encourage accountability, and make sure there are consequences when people do not met them.
Need better distinction between three lines of defense and more resources to perform good in each line

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 10 years
pros: Colleagues you work with are great
cons: The Company prides itself on people being their number one priority, this couldn't be further from the truth. They work you into the ground with very little reward or recognition
advice: Start appreciating the people and the hard work they do, any wonder the turnover in upper management is horrendous

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros: Breakfast and barista coffee provided, interesting people, a sense of change and improvement, willing to take the step to go forward.
cons: Some people who have been there a time may be resistant to change... (but they will love it really).
advice: Keep as you are - personable, approachable and able to listen to the rank and file when they have something prudent to add.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros: Far better management than the previous companies I worked with. Had monthly management reviews and got along well with all colleagues, everyone respected one another
cons: None I can think of at the moment
advice: Keep it up

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros:
Great people to work with.
Project Work and traveling the world. 
Shift work suited my needs.
cons:
Workload was stretched to the limit sometimes.
Upper management sometimes didn't listen. 
Outdated systems in some parts of the business.
advice:
Look at how much a team is struggling before adding to their workload. 
If sections of the business is getting a bonus then everyone should.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than 5 years
pros: Flexibility, employee discounts, work alone
cons: Horrible pay, no corporate support, bad RSM, way too much work for very little pay, pressure to up-sell when rates are ripping customers off. Company let’s the good, hardworking managers go and keep the dumb easy ones to save money. No culture, no growth, bad company that should get bought out. Worst company to work for!
advice: Invest in your employees and treat them with respect. Stop  treating employees like dirt

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Lots of development opportunities and real proactive support around mental health and wellbeing
cons: Always busy, could do with more time at breaks
advice: Enhance awareness of the mental health support available

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for less than a year
pros: Every day is different  you meet customers who are happy as they are going away everyone is so calm and cheerful and even though it's a fast paced  service you never seem to feel it the time just seems to fly
cons: I've not found any as yet
advice: No advice to give other than all the staff at hunts cross are  really supportive  and would like to give credit were it's due

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Cover rate on foreign cash for staff (except your salary won't allow you to travel beyond your city.. so a useless benefit)
cons:
Poor Management, HR non existent. Never seen a caring email come from HR about anything, just for silly surveys that do nothing and don't improve anything. 
They will rip you off with salary and wages.. then fight to make sure you aren't paid for any time owed to you. 
If you are a senior person in the company you are paid well, also if you are friends with the management. Otherwise you get nothing
Lots of...
advice: Appreciate your people who work to help make the business successful. Dont disregard us as nobodies. We work there too and want to see the company succeed but its difficult to be motivated when you are underpaid and undervalued when senior people do much less and get much more.

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros:
Meet lots of happy people going on holiday
Nice colleagues
Good as a stepping stone into finance jobs
cons:
The job is hard to learn. 
The pay is quite bad (currently 21 pence above minimum wage). The job is high responsibility (finance / money and all that entails), target driven and requires use of various IT systems. The majority of your working hours will be spent alone if you are in a small bureau. Some days in the busy periods can be very stressful - dealing with all kinds of problems and doing extreme forms of...
advice: The pay is way too low (by at least £1 an hour)

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros: Great culture and people. Ambitious evolution including cloud-based tech, workday, etc. Determined culture evolution, that is fully inclusive, and supportive to help employees along the journey.
cons: Can be overly paternalistic and have a hang-on of pre-are-change employees, who aren’t at the same calibre of more recent hires, (not all), but can be resistant to the changes being made.
advice: Please be realistic about salaries, working hours and numbers of HC required in non-revenue generating positions.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time
pros:
Lots of stores 
Lots of people
cons:
Not the company it was even 2 years ago
Dreadful management left
advice:
Look after your staff
Don’t pretend you look after your staff

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: Travelex of Charlotte, NC is one of the few locations which isn't run by corporate, so as long as you don't end up working for this particular owner you'll probably enjoy the job.  You get to meet a lot of fascinating people, and handling and learning about all of the various currencies was easily my favorite part about the job!  Overall, Travelex is a pretty good company.  Just don't work at their Charlotte, NC...
cons:
I worked for the Charlotte, NC branch for a year and a half.  This branch had four different Team Managers my last year there, so there was a complete lack of consistency in what the Sales Consultants could expect from their superiors. 

As the Support Trainer, I was responsible for on-boarding and training all new Sales Consultants.  While management may have asked for my input on new hires, my recommendations...
advice: Anything short of the owner losing the contract with Charlotte Douglas International Airport which would allow for corporate to potentially take over and clean house on management, it's impossible to salvage this location due to the complete lack of accountability at the top

description: I have been working at Travelex  for less than a year
pros: Flexible hours, central London location.
cons: Toxic environment, non-existent leadership. There’s no team spirit and it’s a hostile backwards completely adverse to change with a dated product - the senior management refuses to change the digital products. These glowing reviews are written by HR. It’s awful.
advice: Get it sorted. Everyone is trying to leave and it’s just a matter of time you’ll lose great people for the sake of nothing.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time
pros: great pay nice team
cons: no room for advancement
advice: n.a

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros:
Good place to work 

The staff are friendly 

welcoming
cons:
constant changes

hours are long 

management not  good
advice: say please and thank to your staff , and talk to them review them often

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Friendly environment and good team spirit within the company
cons: Stressful at the end of the day to finish deadlines
advice: N/A

description: I worked at Travelex part-time for more than 5 years
pros: You will meet interesting people
cons:
If you work for Travelex Australia, be prepared to be treated like a child. Staff, including store managers, are incapable of doing their job effectively because the company is micromanaged to the extreme by regional management teams that both do not understand the realities of the store experience and refuse to acknowledge staff feedback or ability.

The payroll department of Travelex Australia Ltd are another...
advice: Treat your staff with the level of confidence and competence that your competitor Travel Money Oz does. Perhaps that is one of the reasons why that brand is faring so much better.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time
pros: Uniform. Pension. Holiday. Special rates in currency for staff
cons: Not flexible. Lonely. Low wage for big responsibility
advice: Be more flexible to the needs of the staff. Mum hours, student hours etc and you will get a winning team

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Working for a big brand, fairly good work life balance
cons: Generally a bad place to work, with extremely high turnaround in head office, low morale, hypocritical leadership and poor consideration to employees at most levels.
advice: Sort yourselves out! I had a pretty good first 2 years working at Travelex, followed by a poorly executed leadership restructure post Sean Cornwell's departure. Following on from this, the lack of internal comms, focus on strategy and employers, as well as lack of appreciation for many teams within products and marketing became apparent

description: I worked at Travelex full-time
pros: Pretty decent company for the CV for as long as it doesn't sink, and some fairly decent people.
cons:
This is a company that likes to brand itself as fintech but has the speed and agility of an overweight hippo tracking through a pool of Non-Newtonian fluid. 
Be prepared for no work/life balance, "Heads of" and "Directors" with no teams. And employee turnover that makes a 1-year stay look like lifetime commitment. Bureaucrats galore and people continuously covering their behinds. 
If you're ambitious, know that...
advice:
Learn how to manage people, firstly. Then take a good hard look at yourself and ask if you'd want to be someone reporting into you. 
Along the line, maybe don't refer to front line staff as if they're lazy robots. They are people, there's a reason they dislike you.

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for less than a year
pros: The hours suit me, my colleagues are amazing, I feel like I really am part of a team. I feel supported in my role, and I know I can ask for help without being chastised and the role challenges my brain, which I enjoy.
cons: Customers stopping me on the shop floor and asking me where the washing up liquid is... And having to explain that I don't work for Tesco!
advice: It would be nice if customers could differentiate between us in the bureau and the Tesco staff. It would be lovely to have our own unique uniform.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros: Nice people, willing to help
cons: Boring work, not for me
advice: Make sure to employ for a role that really needs filling

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for more than 3 years
pros: I make it my priority to make beyond the budget of the business because it helps the company to grow and I love interacting with clients and maintain a good service with them.
cons: It’s off season because it get difficult to make budget. And dealing with difficult clients.
advice: To take time to appreciate their employers the word Thank You goes a long way to peoples life.

description: I worked at Travelex part-time
pros: The HR team are being harassed into leaving positive comments on Glassdoor, do not believe the glowing reviews. They are fake!
cons: Poor management, the HR team regularly employs their mates and never advertises jobs externally. Isn’t that illegal? There is a jobs for the boys culture, poor pay and bullying.
advice: Stop employing your mates, be fair, respect people and stop the fake reviews on here!!

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros:
- Great opportunity to learn and develop
- Big focus on diversity, inclusion and wellbeing - more so than anywhere else I've 
  worked before
- Free breakfasts and an in-house Barista
- Friday drinks (fortnightly)
- Great team culture and atmosphere
- A longstanding organisation with a bright future and big ambitions, offering bright prospects
- Flexible working for working parents; imperative for a good...
cons: - Fast-paced, not for the complacent or stagnant employee
advice: Invest a lot in managing your direct reports, they are always willing to learn and progress.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time
pros:
Casual, friendly place to work
Great opportunities to learn and try new things for self starters
cons: Different work environment at different offices
advice: Get out and visit our people who are speaking to our customers

description: I worked at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros: Good support from good managers and there is some good managers.
cons: Can be Very quiet in winter months so it’s lonely
advice: Offer training in quieter months

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for less than a year
pros: Good salary, treat their people well
cons: Not full time, alot of paper work
advice: Give your employees more room to make decisions

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros:
Smart people. 
Exposure to finance/fintech practices.
Pays on time.
Flexible hours and working from home.
Weekly fruit box.
cons:
Egocentric behaviour from management.
Huge amount of dependencies between teams which makes it really hard to do work.
Helpdesk and IT are based in Mumbai, which makes everything cumbersome, to say the least.
Lack of processes where there should be and too many of them where there shouldn't.
Lots of politics.
High turnover.
Lack of visibility.
advice:
Pizza fridays are "cool" but think about people with dietary restrictions.
Value your people, don't just advertise it on LinkedIn.
